name: cornstalk
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the stem of a maize plant (= tall plant grown for its yellow seeds, which are eaten as food, made into flour, or fed to animals): The potatoes were placed inside the hole and covered with straw and cornstalks. The maize crop produces about four tons of cornstalks per acre. Related words
corn
Indian corn
sweetcorn
More examplesFewer examplesHe didn't burn the cornstalks at the end of the season, but left them on the earth to rot.The cornstalks would support the beans as they were growing, and the beans would provide much-needed nitrogen for the corn.They will be able to burn biomass such as grasses or cornstalks along with coal.
